column1: #Text=( 倉吉市 ) is a city in Tottori prefecture .
#Text=Visitors arriving by car can park for free at the city hall , just up the hill from the scenic center of town .
#Text=Kurayoshi is connected on the JR Sanin Line .
#Text=Tourism pamphlets and bus information can be found at Kurayoshi Hotto Plaza ( ［TEL］0858-26-9095 ) located to the west of the bus terminal at Kurayoshi Station .

#Text=Buses from JR Kurayoshi Station run to popular tourist sites like the 20th Century Pear Museum , the Misasa Hot Springs , the Sekigane Hot Springs , Enchoen Chinese Garden , and the Shirakabe Warehouse District .
#Text=Parking is also available at all of these sites for tourists visiting by car .
#Text=Many of the old kura or storehouses in town have been restored and filled with small shops .
#Text=There are many narrow canals and waterways winding through the town which is pleasant for a short walk through the Meiji era houses and store fronts .
#Text=( 鳥取二十世紀梨記念館 なしっこ館 ) , Dakyojicho 198-4 ( 12 min by bus from Kurayoshi station platform #2 , get off at the Kurayoshi Park Square stop ) , ☏ +81 858-23-1174 . 8:30 to 17:30 .

column3: 鳥取二十世紀梨記念館

column1: #Text=The Tottori Nijisseiki Pear Museum celebrates the prefecture 's signature product , the 20th Century Pear .
#Text=This is the only pear museum in Japan .
#Text=It features interactive exhibits highlighting pear production , the history of pears in Japan , a tasting area , a dessert parlor , and more .
#Text=, Nakano-cho ( Bus to Utsubuki Koen Iriguchi ) , ☏ +81 858-22-1200 .
#Text=Every April , Utsubuki Koen is filled with people admiring the 4,000 cherry blossom trees and 40,000 azaleas in the park .
#Text=Utsubuki Koen has been designated one of the top 100 city parks in Japan , and it is also known as one of the top 100 cherry blossom viewing sites in the country .
#Text=In the Shirakabe area , these crafts shops offer visitors the chance to experience traditional Japanese crafts .
#Text=Classes include Hakota doll painting , postcard-making , kite-making , and ceramics .
#Text=Participants must reserve a spot in advance .
#Text=Many small craft shops and antique stores fit the retro theme of this town .
#Text=Antiques can be an especially good deal here if you know what you are looking for .
#Text=, Kurayoshi-shi ( From JR Kurayoshi Station : 12 mins by Hinomaru or Nikko bus Shinai Line , from Shirakabe-Dozogun-Mae bus stop : immediate access . ) , ☏ +81 858-22-1200 .
#Text=The warehouses that line this street comprise some of the oldest buildings in the area , dating back to the Edo and early Meiji periods .

#Text=Shops specializing in sake , oil , rice , or soy sauce once formed a prosperous shopping district , and the old-style buildings with white plastered walls , black wall panels , and red tiled roofs give an authentic glimpse back into old Japan .
#Text=Many of these buildings have since been remodeled on the inside to offer regional crafts and souvenirs .
#Text=You can also try soy sauce ice cream and specialty coffees here .
#Text=Utsubuki Kouen dango are a signature sweet of the Kurayoshi area , and they are available in many souvenir shops across the prefecture .
